glosses: To move regularly in the same direction; to swing, to rock, to shake.

examples.text: Arık, zayıf bir buzağı kuyruğunu sallayarak gidiyordu.
examples.translation: A thin calf was walking around wagging its tail.

glosses: To make up, to think up, to fabricate, to take a stab in the dark.
To constantly postpone a task or responsibility; to buy time, to drag one's feet, to procrastinate

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish صاللامق (ṣallamaḳ, “to swing or rock to and fro, to mind, to pay attention”), from Ottoman Turkish صالمق (ṣalmaḳ, “to let go, to free, to let hang down, to send”), from Proto-Turkic *sal- (“to swing, to let hang down, to let go, to spare, to set free, to drop, to lower”). Cognates with Azerbaijani sallamaq.
